definitions.definition: used when the subject of the verb is "it" and the object is the same thing, animal, situation, or idea:
examples: The cat licked itself all over.

definitions.definition: used to emphasize the subject when it is a thing, animal, situation, or idea:
examples: The shop itself (= only the shopand nothing else) started 15 years ago but the internet side of the business is new.
The animal had been left in the house by itself for a week.
The committee kept the results of the survey to itself (= did not tell anyone), fearing a bad public reaction.
